job_title: Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Description

The Supply Chain & Materials Management (SCMM) Team is responsible for supply chain forecasting, scheduling, and inventory management to enable the Global Clinical Supply (GCS) business. The scope includes drug products, placebos, packaging components and clinical finished goods. The Team assures accurate siting and balancing of supply chain activities against work center capacity, and the efficient management of changes to minimize the risk of delivery to final depot. The group also maintains a keen forward-looking view of the overall clinical portfolio of demand and partners across the business to ensure execution strategy is well-positioned for future supply chain dynamics.

The Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst will support data analytics for the overall Master Planning Team for activities such as: siting, forecasting, scheduling, balancing, labeling, releasing, capacity management and any ad-hoc analysis and reporting related to the Master Planning scope of work. The Senior Specialist may be asked to generate, analyze, model, and visualize data to enable data-informed decision making, by understanding our organization’s processes, and delivering relevant actionable insights.

The Senior Specialist will partner with the different areas of Master Planning to create, develop and implement a range of reports and solutions that will enable the incorporation of best practice data analytics into all aspects of day-to day business as well as ad-hoc evaluations. The Senior Specialist will partner with other stakeholders such as Logistics, Planning, Operations, Business Analytics, etc.) to develop and support new high business value digital applications and tools that meet both ongoing and developing business needs.

Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to :
• Support the Master Planning Team with data analytics and report creation.
• Provide ongoing support to the analytics tools being used across the Team.
• Support metric and KPI collection and tracking as needed.
• Collaborate with internal partners (both within and outside of GCS) to assess, align and optimize supply chain analytic tools.

Education :
• Bachelor's degree in data science, a related technical field, or equivalent professional experience.

Experience and Skills :
• 3+ years’ experience using Data Analytics and Visualization tools. Knowledge of clinical supply processes preferred.
• Advance level of Excel – pivot tables, charts & graphs, calculations, data process automation, etc.
• Strong awareness of diversity and inclusion principles
• Proven track record of effective problem solving, and attention to detail.
• Strong organizational and time management skills and ability to prioritize tasks and initiatives appropriately.
• Results-orientation with the proven ability to execute on collaborative projects.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication and relationship skills along with high personal integrity, credibility, and energy.
• SAP supply chain knowledge and experience preferred.
• Demonstrated high level of initiative and ability to function independently with minimal or no daily supervision.

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we “follow the science” that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.

Who we are …

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for …

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us—and start making your impact today.

NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS

In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.

If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.

Residents of Colorado

Click here (https://survey.sogosurvey.com/Survey1.aspx?k=SsQYWYYQsQRsPsPsP&lang=0) to request this role’s pay range.

job_description:
Data Analyst, REMOTE!Imagine working for a company that inspired this kind of employee feedback. I'm proud to work for Elkay. The company invests in my success. I do work that makes a difference. I love my co-workers. I feel like part of a family. When you come to work for Elkay, that is exactly what you will experience. Elkay is a thriving, values-driven company focused on doing the right things so we can be in business forever. We're financially-stable and family-owned, with an enduring reputation for ethics, integrity, giving back, and providing an engaging, inclusive environment where careers flourish and grow. At Elkay, we never forget that our strength lies in our people. Our employees are the driving force behind Elkay's superior quality, product ingenuity, and exceptional customer experience. Our commitment to our people and their professional development is a recipe for success that has fueled our growth from a three-person shop in 1920 to one of today's leading international suppliers of plumbing, water delivery, and branded commercial interiors. If you're ready to join a company where everything you do makes a difference and you go home proud at the end of each day, talk to us about joining the Elkay family! DATA ANALYST OPPORTUNITY FOR ELKAY INTERIOR SYSTEMS! ROLE CAN BE REMOTE! Elkay Interior Systems (EIS), an Elkay Company, is a global interior design and manufacturing company, offering an array of design, build, and installation services to the restaurant, retail, education, and hospitality markets. EIS simplifies the complicated. By leveraging insights gained from working with global brands, we cultivate environments that are dynamic and profitable, designing experiences customers will remember. We are thinkers, designers, and builders, crafting extraordinary environments. Primary focus is to coordinate with Elkay's Master Data Management initiatives in areas such as product and customer, within Elkay's MDM framework. Drive data ownership and governance within the corporate MDM framework. Guide the creation of data definitions, standards, and processes to consistently address recurring product and costing data issues such as quality and consistency. Develop improvement processes, create tools and templates, and provide training related to data reporting. Work with IT to implement MDM initiatives in systems and applications. Provide direction and monitoring of work progress including status of agreed upon deliverables as well as:
Creation of strategies, architectures, templates, and tools to manage product and costing data. Development of policies, definitions, standards, and processes for costing data. Responsible for managing compliance to policies, definitions, and standards. Drive data change to correspond to master data strategies. Develop and analyze data quality reports and track areas of non-compliance. Drive correction action in areas of non-compliance. Collaborate with IT Functional and Technical team members, including BI team, to implement master data initiatives. Implement initiatives to further enhance/enrich completeness and value of Master Data.
Qualifications:
3
years of experience in data analysis is required. Bachelor's degree or greater is required; a degree in a technical area is preferred but not required. 3
years' experience managing data management projects is preferred. Technical experience in data analysis with SQL is strongly preferred. Experience working with Epicor modules such as PIM, Agile, and/or E-Business Suite is strongly preferred. Experience with the various business functions of the manufacturing industry is preferred. Experience with reporting in OBIEE, Discoverer, and Salesforce.com is preferred. Competent in specialty but still building skills in area of specialty. Requires occasional guidance and review by supervisors/managers on complex problems. Strong verbal and written communication skills for interaction with business users, partners, and team members. Able to lead meetings and present in PowerPoint. Proven analytical and problem-solving skills and detail orientation are a must.
Salary Range:
$80K -- $100K
Minimum Qualification
Data Science & Machine Learning, Database AdministrationEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.

job_description:
Key Responsibilities

" Advise on, design, and implement solutions that prepares data for additional analytical or operational uses, e.g. data provision to data scientists

" Gather needs and requirements from end users to facilitate development of solutions to satisfy data needs for data analysis and integrations.

" Build data pipelines to pull together information from different source systems; integrating, consolidating and cleansing data; and structuring it for use in individual analytics applications and other operational uses

" Design, develop, and implement architecture and processes to populate and store data for use by data analysts and integrations with other operations.

" Work closely with other data analysts to coordinate the use of end-user tools to facilitate the analysis and reporting process.

" Be a consultant for projects, products and initiatives when it comes to data topics.

" Work together with IT enterprise architects in order to help to implement the data model and any other data aspects into the system landscape of AGCS.

" Understand and promote meta-data management and data modelling.

" Support products, projects and initiatives in harmonizing data, documentation of business data terms and definitions and technical lineage.

" Provide and maintain the respective documents/ frameworks including a Business Data Model and the data requirements capturing process instructions.

" Define and implement systematic Data Governance processes using the Allianz Group Data management tool and exchange with the wider AGCS and Allianz Data Community.

Internal

Behavioural Competencies

" Is effective in a variety of communication settings: one-on-one, small and large groups and among diverse styles and position levels and flexes communication style accordingly.

" Works cooperatively and partners with others across the organisation to get work done

" Gains trust and support of others

" Consulting and Change Management skills: relationship management, customer satisfaction, understand customer needs, facilitation, consulting with business leading to overall goal of promoting Importance of aligned data structures for AGCS

" Strong analysis, problem solving, judgment and decision making skills

" Is resilient and confident under pressure

" Handles and manages crisis effectively

" Grows from hardships and negative experiences

Technical Competencies

" Insurance knowledge in general is required. Specialization in functions like Accounting/Actuarial, Claims, Operations, Underwriting specifically from a data perspective a plus.

" Understanding of information systems and data life-cycle management best practices and methodologies.

" Good understanding of Agile development methodologies like SAFe

" Experience with enterprise wide data management technologies

" Experience with Erwin Data Modeller, Power Designer or comparable data modelling tools

" Knows how to document data flows and enable the connection between data governance functions like a business glossary and metadata tools in an automated way.

" High competency in SQL and Data modelling Standards for 3NF and Data Vault

" Good understanding of extract, transform and load (ETL) tools and REST-oriented APIs for creating and managing data integration jobs

" Ability to work with both structured and unstructured data sets

" Exposure to data ingestion and processing frameworks

" Preferred knowledge in industry standard frameworks such as DAMA, DMBOK " MS Office skills (particularly Excel, PowerPoint, Access, VBA). " Advanced Data Analysis skills (Data Profiling, PL/SQL for Oracle, ETL Tools, Reporting tools like SAS) a strong advantage " Metadata & data governance suits (e.g. Informatica, IBM, DAG, Collibra and Metadata Bridges) " Data Integration (e.g. Informatica, Talend, Ab Initio and IBM) " Data visualisation (e.g. Composite/Tibco and Denodo) " Visualization & BI (e.g. Microsoft, Cognos, MicroStrategy, Tableau, Qlik, OBIEE, Hyperion)

Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

job_title: Data Analytics and AI Lead - Brand, Marketing and Insights
job_description:
You’re an original. So are we.

We’re a company of people who like to forge our own path. We invented the blue jean in 1873, and we reinvented khaki pants in 1986. We pioneered labor and environmental guidelines in manufacturing. And we work to build sustainability into everything we do. Our brands stand for freedom and self-expression around the world.

Where we lead, others follow. For more than 160 years, we’ve used the strength of our brands to lead with our values and make an outsized impact on the world. We employ more than 15,000 people globally to support our great brands: Levi’s®, Dockers®, Denizen® and Signature by Levi Strauss & Co.™

About the Job:

The Data, Analytics, and AI Lead is responsible for strategy, application, and execution of analytics supporting the Brand and Marketing areas in Levi Strauss & Co., in addition to analytics and insights related to macroeconomic and consumer trends. They will collaborate with leadership teams and other colleagues to prioritize and size the opportunity of AI applications, and lead a small team of data scientists and engineers to execute and deliver value from those priorities. This role requires a rare blend of business acumen and -big picture- strategic thinking with a proven track record of delivering commercial value; detailed, granular knowledge of data, operational systems, statistics, machine learning, and AI techniques; deep retail background; empathy to engage with colleagues from a wide range of backgrounds; and the ability to lead and inspire others within their team and across the organization, embodying the values and passions that characterize Levi Strauss & Co.

This role can be based in the US or Europe (with half day overlap with the Pacific time US), reporting to the Global Head of Data, Analytics, Artificial Intelligence. They will be a member of the Global Strategy and AI leadership team, with responsibility to package and share key learnings and models across the team and the company.

Key responsibilities:
• Based on priorities and stakeholder needs, set and own the analytics and AI strategy and roadmap for Brand, Marketing, and Insights.Identify and prioritize the highest value use cases, data and technology requirements, and implementation considerations
• Deliver commercial value through data, analytics, and AI use cases, measured in $ of revenue/EBIT growth, $ of cost savings, and uplift / improvement compared to previous approaches
• Partner with the global team to drive faster speed to execution; promote re-use; borrow shamelessly and share selflessly across regions; build consensus around buy or build decisions when necessary
• Manage implementation and automation of projects, embedding analytics within the organization; quickly scale in-progress to pilot; pilot to production; production to automation
• Grow and develop team, providing hands-on technical leadership to data scientists
• Raise analytical acumen throughout the organization; demonstrate a spirit of cooperation, teamwork, and transparency; promote a growth mindset and culture of continuous learning and improvement, empathy, and humility

About You:
• Advanced degree in a quantitative discipline (statistics, computer science, social sciences) with knowledge of SQL, Python, Spark, machine learning / AI techniques, cloud computing
• Prior experience in a business-focused data science role, with demonstrated examples of commercial impact through data science and AI
• Proven ability to lead technical and business teams in a matrixed organization; work closely with data, technology and business teams; influence at all levels of the organization
• Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with ability to tell stories through data, leveraging effective data visualization
• High level of organization and detail orientation, with ability to work across multiple projects/initiatives, troubleshoot and problem solve
• Previous experience in a retail company; previous experience in brand, marketing, media measurement desirable
• Self-starter able to build and grow teams over time

Team management: Responsible for a small team highly technical data scientists (medium to high professional level), to grow over time

Budget ownership: Oversee and make effective use of approximately $1m annual budget to fund external resources, data and technology enablement

Reporting line: Global Commercial Head of Data, Analytics, and AI

We put a lot of thought into our programs to provide you with a benefits package that matters. Whether it is for medical care, taking time off, improving your health or planning for retirement, we've got you covered. Here's a small snapshot:
• 401K match: $1.25 for every $1.00 you contribute up to the first 6% of pay you save.
• Five hours of paid volunteer time per month with nonprofit organizations
• Product discount of 60% off regular-price merchandise
• Paid Family Leave

EOE M/F/Disability/Vets

LOCATION

San Francisco, CA, USA

FULL TIME/PART TIME

Full time

job_description:
Under limited supervision, the Data Analyst focuses on resolving data integration, data validation, business intelligence, and data reconciliation issues. The processes include gathering requirements, importing, cleaning, transforming, validating data with the purpose of understanding, or making conclusions, from/about the data. Deliverables may include DDL or DML SQL commands, processes designed to improve data quality, data consolidations to support one-off business needs, presentations reviewing conclusions gained from analyzing data, documents detailing business requirements as they pertain to data, and specifications covering the data necessary to address the business requirements. ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Analyze complex data systems and document data elements, data flow, relationships and dependencies describing what/how/where/why data is stored and how to access the data. Document and cross-reference business data terms and definitions that occur in various databases. The purpose is to help the business and IT better understand the data, how to use and support the data. Analyze and evaluate content and performance of queries, reports, and other data-based processes suggesting improvements which may include changes in the structure or indexing of data, as well as programming changes in generation, and distribution of reports/queries. Review and analyze data from multiple internal and external sources with ability to interpret data that is not well defined or documented and develop recommendations based on findings. Conduct detailed analysis of databases and systems to identify real or potential data quality issues including accuracy, completeness, relevance, and timeliness. Develop data reconciliation and cleansing solutions. Communicate data analysis results to senior management. Identify and present findings, and follow through to completion, process improvements that improve data quality, drive efficiency, mitigate risk, or provide new value to the organization. Work with the architecture teams to ensure compliance to architectural standards and provide feedback to those teams to improve the architecture BASIC QUALIFICATIONS A Bachelor's degree from an accredited program or equivalent direct relevant experience. At least 5
years of experience analyzing business data. At least 2 years of advanced, demonstratable database query (SQL) experience required. Experience with data management, business intelligence and data visualization tools (i.e. PowerBI, Cognos, Tableau, Alteryx). Experience with enterprise data warehouses. PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Retail industry experience. Experience with Google Big Query (GBQ). Explore Location
Salary Range:
$80K -- $100K
Minimum Qualification
Business Intelligence & AnalyticsEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.

job_title: Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst
job_description:
**Job Description**

The Supply Chain & Materials Management (SCMM) Team is responsible for supply chain forecasting, scheduling, and inventory management to enable the Global Clinical Supply (GCS) business. The scope includes drug products, placebos, packaging components and clinical finished goods. The Team assures accurate siting and balancing of supply chain activities against work center capacity, and the efficient management of changes to minimize the risk of delivery to final depot. The group also maintains a keen forward-looking view of the overall clinical portfolio of demand and partners across the business to ensure execution strategy is well-positioned for future supply chain dynamics.

The Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst will support data analytics for the overall Master Planning Team for activities such as: siting, forecasting, scheduling, balancing, labeling, releasing, capacity management and any ad-hoc analysis and reporting related to the Master Planning scope of work. The Senior Specialist may be asked to generate, analyze, model, and visualize data to enable data-informed decision making, by understanding our organization's processes, and delivering relevant actionable insights.

The Senior Specialist will partner with the different areas of Master Planning to create, develop and implement a range of reports and solutions that will enable the incorporation of best practice data analytics into all aspects of day-to day business as well as ad-hoc evaluations. The Senior Specialist will partner with other stakeholders such as Logistics, Planning, Operations, Business Analytics, etc.) to develop and support new high business value digital applications and tools that meet both ongoing and developing business needs.
• *Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to** :

+ Support the Master Planning Team with data analytics and report creation.

+ Provide ongoing support to the analytics tools being used across the Team.

+ Support metric and KPI collection and tracking as needed.

+ Collaborate with internal partners (both within and outside of GCS) to assess, align and optimize supply chain analytic tools.
• *Education** :

+ Bachelor's degree in data science, a related technical field, or equivalent professional experience.
• *Experience and Skills** :

+ 3+ years' experience using Data Analytics and Visualization tools. Knowledge of clinical supply processes preferred.

+ Advance level of Excel - pivot tables, charts & graphs, calculations, data process automation, etc.

+ Strong awareness of diversity and inclusion principles

+ Proven track record of effective problem solving, and attention to detail.

+ Strong organizational and time management skills and ability to prioritize tasks and initiatives appropriately.

+ Results-orientation with the proven ability to execute on collaborative projects.

+ Exceptional written and verbal communication and relationship skills along with high personal integrity, credibility, and energy.

+ SAP supply chain knowledge and experience preferred.

+ Demonstrated high level of initiative and ability to function independently with minimal or no daily supervision.

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we "follow the science" that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.
• *Who we are ...**

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.
• *What we look for ...**

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us-and start making your impact today.
• *NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS**

In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.

If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.
• *Residents of Colorado**

Click here ([Link available when viewing the job] to request this role's pay range.

Please understand that, as permitted by applicable law, if you have not been vaccinated against COVID-19 and an essential function of your job is to call on external stakeholders who require vaccination to enter their premises or engage in face-to-face meetings, then your employment may pose an undue burden to business operations, in which case you may not be offered employment, or your employment could be terminated. job_description:
Through our dedicated associates, Conduent delivers mission-critical services and solutions on behalf of Fortune 100 companies and over 500 governments – creating exceptional outcomes for our clients and the millions of people who count on them.

You have an opportunity to personally thrive, make a difference and be part of a culture where individuality is noticed and valued every day.

Job Description

The Governance, Risk and Compliance (GRC) Data Analyst II reports to the Senior Director, Cybersecurity & Technology Risk and will work with a team of five full-time risk and governance professionals and cross-functionally across Global Risk. Primary accountabilities include cataloging, reviewing, analyzing, and providing governance, risk, and compliance driven metrics and insights using multiple data sources and analytic tools. These tools primarily consist of SharePoint and PowerBI but may include other data sources and analytic capabilities. This individual should have familiarity with information technology controls, key performance indicators, and key risk indicators.

The GRC Data Analyst II will help develop and implement an overall cybersecurity and technology metrics strategy, transform data into insight and insight into key performance and risk indicators that will help inform and drive cyber & tech risk decisions. This individual will help ensure that data and metrics are relevant and that the processes used to collect, analyze and visualize, and sustainable at an enterprise level.

This individual may be based remotely and should be open to occasional travel as necessary.

Accountabilities
• Gather, manage, and analyze information from specified data sources. This data source will primarily be SharePoint but may include other data sources as required
• In conjunction with other team members, help drive the development of Key Performance Indicators (KPI) and Key Risk Indicators (KRI)
• Assist in creating and presenting KPIs and KRIs
• Develop, publish, and maintain process documents to enable and ensure successful recurring data collection, analysis, and reporting
• Use analytic tools (Power BI) to develop graphs, infographics and other methods to visualize data
• Utilizing SharePoint as the primary GRC platform, work with a global team in various GRC platform administration responsibilities, including evaluation, design, and implementation of new capabilities. Execute administrative tasks in the GRC platform to support ongoing use such as data collection, report generation, record status monitoring and tracking, user and workflow management
• Work as a point of contact and subject matter expert for GRC platform information requests and issue management and escalations
• Facilitate requirements design, development, testing, implementations, and on-going support and administration of the SharePoint GRC platform

Required Qualifications
• Minimum Bachelor’s Degreein Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Analytics, or related field
• Experience with designing and developing PowerBI dashboards
• Experience in utilizing or developing SharePoint-based platforms

Desired Qualifications
• Understanding of technology and cybersecurity concepts and principles
• Industry knowledge in enterprise-level information technology architecture, operations, and cybersecurity operations
• Holds certifications in one or more areas related to cyber or information security (e.g., Security+, CISSP, CISA, etc.).

Qualities/Attributes
• Impeccable integrity
• Exceptional professional presence
• Polished, effective, and credible communicator
• Highly organized with a delivery focus
• Strategic thinker
• Possesses and demonstrates sound judgment
• Accountable
• Relationship builder with a partnering philosophy and mindset
• Transparent, collaborative operating style
• Leads by example, fostering an appropriate high-performance team culture of accountability

Closing

Conduent is an Equal Opportunity Employer and considers applicants for all positions without regard to race, color, creed, religion, ancestry, national origin, age, gender identity, gender expression, sex/gender, marital status, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, medical condition, use of a guide dog or service animal, military/veteran status, citizenship status, basis of genetic information, or any other group protected by law.

People with disabilities who need a reasonable accommodation to apply for or compete for employment with Conduent may request such accommodation(s) by clicking on the following link, completing the accommodation request form, and submitting the request by using the “Submit” button at the bottom of the form. For those using Google Chrome or Mozilla Firefox please download the form first: click here to access or download the form. You may also click here to access Conduent’s ADAAA Accommodation Policy.

At Conduent we value the health and safety of our associates, their families and our community. For US applicants while we DO NOT require vaccination for most of our jobs, we DO require that you provide us with your vaccination status, where legally permissible. Providing this information is a requirement of your employment at Conduent.

job_title: Staff Data Analyst - People Analytics Product Manager
job_description:
Position Summary...

What you'll do...

About the Team/Position

One word: Impact

Our 2.2 million associates truly make the difference. The Associate Analytics team empowers our associates around the world to do more for our customers by improving people decisions through science, insight, and automation. We influence Walmart's people policies; test & evaluate program and intervention effectiveness; create scaled AI/ML people solutions; and deliver insights that improve our associates' experience. Our team has recently expanded scope so we're looking to grow quicklycome build with us!

The Senior Manager, Product Management is responsible for leading all product management activities for multiple Associate Analytics', Scaled BI products with an end goal of empowering our customers to make the best possible, data driven decisions for their business. The Product Manager should be an intense customer advocate who expertly captures the voice of our customer throughout the product life cycle. They should also be an influential consultant with experience in both the people/human resources function as well as building analytics products/capabilities. Lastly, the Product Manager will closely partner with our Data Stewardship and Business Intelligence teams - often leading agile ceremonies and overseeing the scrum, iterative development process end-to-end.

You'll sweep us off our feet if...
• You have experience in People Analytics product management and/or consulting capacity with a strong passion in improving overall employee/associate experience through Scaled BI Solutions.
• You are adept in requirements scoping, uncovering the pain points of customers, translating into business requirements for products and solutions that provide the best, most insightful solution, or experience for our customers.
• You have experience driving change management and solution adoption across multiple personas and products through push/pull communication channels and other change management techniques.
• You have experience implementing scaled customer listening mechanisms for established and new products with a goal of leveraging feedback to build prioritized product backlogs.
• You should be comfortable influencing senior leaders and business stakeholders while also building strong relationships across the functional and technology teams.
• You are comfortable leading agile ceremonies and partnering with teams to successfully execute throughout the product development cycle.

You'll make an impact by...

Data Source Identification: Supporting the understanding of the priority order of requirements and service level agreements. Helping identify the most suitable source for data that is fit for purpose. Performing initial data quality checks on extracted data.

Data Strategy: Understanding, articulating, and applying principles of the defined strategy to routine business problems that involve a single function.

Understanding Business Context: Requires knowledge of Industry and environmental factors; Common business vernacular; Business practices across two or more domains such as product, finance, marketing, sales, technology, business systems, and human resources and in-depth knowledge of related practices; Directly relevant business metrics and business areas. To Provide recommendations to business stakeholders to solve complex business issues. Develop business cases for projects with a projected return on investment or cost savings. Translate business requirements into projects, activities, and tasks and aligns to overall business strategy and develops domain specific artifact. Serve as an interpreter and conduit to connect business needs with tangible solutions and results. Identify and recommend relevant business insights pertaining to their area of work.

Tech. Problem Formulation: Requires knowledge of Analytics/big data analytics / automation techniques and methods; Business understanding; Precedence and use cases; Business requirements and insights. To translate/ co-own business problems within one's discipline to data related or mathematical solutions. Identify appropriate methods/tools to be leveraged to provide a solution for the problem. Share use cases and gives examples to demonstrate how the method would solve the business problem.

Data Visualization: Generating appropriate graphical representations of data and model outcomes. Understanding customer requirements to design appropriate data representation for multiple data sets. Working with User Experience designers and User Interface engineers as required to build front end applications. Presenting to and influencing the team and business audience using the appropriate frameworks and conveys clear messages through business and stakeholder understanding. Customizing communication style based on stakeholder under guidance and leverages rational arguments. Guiding and mentoring junior associates on story types, structures, and techniques based on context.
• Demonstrating up-to-date expertise and applies this to the development, execution, and improvement of action plans by providing expert advice and guidance to others in the application of information and best practices; supporting and aligning efforts to meet customer and business needs; and building commitment for perspectives and rationales.
• Providing and supporting the implementation of business solutions by building relationships and partnerships with key stakeholders; identifying business needs; determining and carrying out necessary processes and practices; monitoring progress and results; recognizing and capitalizing on improvement opportunities; and adapting to competing demands, organizational changes, and new responsibilities.
• Modeling compliance with company policies and procedures and supports company mission, values, and standards of ethics and integrity by incorporating these into the development and implementation of business plans; using the Open Door Policy; and demonstrating and assisting others with how to apply these in executing business processes and practices.

The above information has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work performed in the role. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job. The full Job Description can be made available as part of the hiring process.

Benefits & Perks

At Walmart, we offer competitive pay as well as performance-based incentive awards and other great benefits for a happier mind, body, and wallet. Health benefits include medical, vision and dental coverage. Financial benefits include 401(k), stock purchase and company-paid life insurance. Paid time off benefits include PTO (including sick leave), parental leave, family care leave, bereavement, jury duty and voting. Other benefits include short-term and long-term disability, education assistance with college degrees, company discounts, military service pay, adoption expense reimbursement, and more.

Eligibility requirements apply to some benefits and may depend on your job classification and length of employment. Benefits are subject to change and may be subject to a specific plan or program terms. For information about benefits and eligibility, see One.Walmart.com/Health

Equal Opportunity Employer

Walmart, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer - By Choice. We believe we are best equipped to help our associates, customers and the communities we serve live better when we really know them. That means understanding, respecting and valuing diversity- unique styles, experiences, identities, ideas and opinions - while being inclusive of all people.

Minimum Qualifications...

Outlined below are the required minimum qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no minimum qualifications.

Option 1: Bachelor's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Arts, Finance or related field and 3 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 2: Master's degree in Business, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field and 1 year's experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field. Option 3: 5 years' experience in data analysis, data science, statistics, or related field.

Preferred Qualifications...

Outlined below are the optional preferred qualifications for this position. If none are listed, there are no preferred qualifications.

Data science, data analysis, statistics, or related field, Master's degree in Business, Computer Science, Engineering, Statistics, Economics, Analytics, Mathematics, Computer Science, Information Technology or related field, Related industry experience (for example, retail, merchandising, healthcare, eCommerce), Successful completion of assessments in data analysis and Business Intelligence tools and scripting languages (for example, SQL, Python, Spark, Scala, R, Power BI, or Tableau)

Primary Location...
508 SW 8TH ST, BENTONVILLE, AR 72712, United States of America

job_description:
Job Title: Data Analyst / Engineer

Location: Bloomfield, CT

Duration: Full-time

Job Description: Job Title Data Analyst / Engineer Relevant Experience (in Yrs) 6-8 yrs Technical/Functional Skills Must have knowledge and expertise on TDM Process / Tools & SQL, Healthcare Domain Experience, Converting business requirements into data requirements, Jira. Experience Required 4-5 yrs Roles & Responsibilities As a Data Analyst for a centralized Test Data Manufacturing team you are expected to understand the project requirements and convert them into the data requirements and manufacture the same in application. Your job will be to identify the integrated data flow path and the jobs that would downstream the data to other applicable downstream applications. Your will be responsible for delivering the data on time with high quality for different testing phases(System testing, Integration testing, release testing). You will develop the data strategy for major programs or projects that needs data support. The Candidate must have strong leadership, communication and technical skills as well as the ability to work well in a team environment. The ability to handle aggressive timelines is a must.

Tools: Expert on TDM and SQL

Automation tool: UFT, Selenium, excel Macros

Job Description
• Understands and converts the business requirements to data requirements.
• Apply contextual knowledge to deliver the most relevant solutions that fit Customer's unique needs.
• Work with Project/Business teams to understand the scenarios.
• Mentor and coach team members and set them up with training and processes to iterate and deliver data solutions efficiently.
• Possess working SQL knowledge and experience working with relational databases.
• Manages multiple projects, professional/technical staff and other related activities of the area.
• Understand the data flow and provides the data integrated solutions for the customers.
Skills
• Strong understanding data management, data flow and databases.
• Healthcare Data and/or Business knowledge with understanding of the terminology, concepts and value chain
• Ability to work in an agile environment, in cross functional teams, delivering data in a fast paced environment
• Ability to form strong business relationships and partner across the enterprise for effective cross-functional project delivery
• Demonstrate enthusiasm, influence and innovation
• Infuse and maintain a sense of urgency
• Distinct customer focus and quality mindset
• Strong analytical and problem solving skills paired with the ability to develop creative and efficient solutions
• Ability to effectively communicate at all levels of the organization, converting complex challenges into simplified options and recommendations
Education BE, BE Tech Start date (dd-mmm-yy) ASAP

Diverse Lynx LLC is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive due consideration for employment without any discrimination. All applicants will be evaluated solely on the basis of their ability, competence and their proven capability to perform the functions outlined in the corresponding role. We promote and support a diverse workforce across all levels in the company.

job_description:
Join Our Team! Sunbelt Rentals strives to be the customer's first choice in the equipment rental industry. From pumps to scaffolding to general construction tools, we aim to be the only call needed to outfit a job site with the proper equipment. Not only do we offer a vast fleet that ranks among the best in the industry, we pair it all with a friendly and knowledgeable staff. Our employees are our greatest asset, and although we present a comprehensive equipment offering, our expertise and service are what truly distinguish us from the competition. We pride ourselves on investing in our workforce and offer competitive benefits, as well as extensive on-the-job training for all eligible employees. As a highly successful national company, we are constantly looking for talented individuals to support our growth. If you are interested in pursuing a rewarding career, we invite you to review our opportunities! JOB DESCRIPTION SUMMARY Data Analyst, ML & AI Business Integration Sunbelt's Data Analyst, ML & AI Business Integration is equipped for success so we can make it happen for our customers. Sunbelt is investing in advanced analytics leveraging data, analytics, machine learning, and artificial intelligence. The Data Analyst, ML & AI Business Integration supports various product and project teams using data expertise and technical analysis. The Data Analyst will tell a story with data using sophisticated data visualization tools and data models. Education or experience that prepares you for success:
Bachelors degree in data analytics field (e.g., Statistics, Applied Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent work experience 3-5 years of modeling/analytics experience required, with at least 1-2 years of experience building analytical models and at least 2 years of experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI Masters' degree in a data analytics related field (e.g. Statistics, Applied Mathematics, etc.) or equivalent work experience preferred Familiarity with Agile a plus Knowledge/Skills/Abilities you may rely on:
Quantitative analytical techniques, from descriptive statistical analysis to predictive and prescriptive analytic solutions Model lifecycle management Data structures and data stitching SQL, especially for data stitching and data discovery R or Python to further develop expertise in possibly both languages Data visualization tools such as Power BI in concert with deep business understanding Safety is key to our culture:
The physical demands of this role require bending, squatting, crouching, reaching, lifting 25 pounds or more, and working indoors/outdoors when required by the job. The above description is not a complete listing of all miscellaneous, incidental or similar duties which may be required from day to day. Reasonable accommodations may be made to comply with applicable laws. We value an inclusive and diverse workplace:
Sunbelt Rentals is an Equal Opportunity Employer -- Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran and any other protected class. Columbia, SC Notification:
This position is subject to a background check for any convictions directly related to its duties and responsibilities. Only job-related convictions will be considered and will not automatically disqualify the candidate. Gear up for an exciting career! If a current Sunbelt Rentals employee has referred you for an employment opportunity please notify them that you are applying for this position. In order for the employee to get a referral bonus they need to contact their regional recruiter.
Salary Range:
$80K -- $100K
Minimum Qualification
Data Science & Machine Learning, Database AdministrationEstimated Salary: $20 to $28 per hour based on qualifications.

job_description:
Panasonic – Data Analyst Intern

Every moment of every day, people all over the world turn to Panasonic to make their lives simpler, more enjoyable, more productive and more secure. Since our founding almost a century ago, we’ve been committed to improving peoples’ lives and making the world a better place–one customer, one business, one innovative leap at a time. Come join our journey.

Click here to learn more about how Panasonic is creating a better life, a better world.

Watch this video to see how our employees are shaping the technologies that move us.

What You'll Get to Do:

Reporting and Communication:
• Create visualizations, dashboards, and reports to communicate findings to stakeholders
• Provide insights to team members to help inform business decisions

Data Collection and Preparation:
• Assist with collecting and cleaning large data sets from various sources
• Organize and maintain databases, ensuring accuracy and consistency
• Collaborate with team members to identify relevant data sources and extract information

Data Analysis:
• Analyze data to identify trends, patterns, and insights
• Help develop and maintain statistical models and predictive analytics
• Continuously monitor data quality and provide recommendations for improvement

Learning and Development:
• Stay up to date with the latest tools and techniques in data analysis
• Attend training sessions and webinars to improve knowledge and skills

What You'll Bring:

Education and Experience:
• Currently pursuing a degree in a relevant field, e.g., data science, statistics, computer science
• Must be proficient in Microsoft Office software with an emphasis on Excel
• Proficiency in at least one data analysis tool such as R, Python
• Experience with data visualization and dashboard creation
• Familiarity with statistical modeling and predictive analytics

Competencies:
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills
• Ability to work independently and manage time effectively

Communications:
• Communicates with all levels of organization including executive management as well as customers and suppliers. Requires professional communications.

Hourly Range: $17.00 - $38.00

The minimum hourly wage for this role will be the greater of the posted range, or minimum wage for the location where the employee will be working, subject to local minimum wage requirements.

Panasonic is proud to be an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity, sex, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, and any other characteristic protected by law or company policy. All qualified individuals are required to perform the essential functions of the job with or without reasonable accommodation. Pre-employment drug testing is required for safety sensitive positions or as may otherwise be required by contract or law. Due to the high volume of responses, we will only be able to respond to candidates of interest. All candidates must have valid authorization to work in the U.S. Thank you for your interest in Panasonic Corporation of North America.

job_title: Data Science Intern - Machine Learning and Analytics
job_description:
Tencent Games Global Publishing Technology Team is the international unit of Tencent Games, a leading global platform for game development, publishing, and operation. Aiming to improve our games and transform the gaming industry, our mission is to solve the toughest challenges in gaming with technology.

With offices in Palo Alto and around the world, our growth strategy is to build upon attracting the best talent and creating an amazing work atmosphere that balances the energy of a start-up with the resources of a global innovation leader. As the world’s leading technology company, we maintain an entrepreneurial spirit and an open mindset.

If you are passionate about the gaming industry and eager to do groundbreaking work in a friendly, cross-cultural environment, we can provide unparalleled stability, resources, access to more than a billion players, and an international perspective.

If you like us are ambitious and self-driven, we invite you to explore Tencent Games Global Publishing Center Tech Team and take challenges that will create new adventures for billions of players.

Responsibilities
• We are hiring internships for the applied machine learning and growth DS team.
• Join a highly-skilled data science team?to mine through big data by applying advanced analytic methods, to solve challenging problems and to deliver scalable solutions in game development, publishing, and live-ops.
• Establish scalable, efficient, automated processes and provide end-to-end data products with large-scale data analysis, experimentation, machine learning/deep learning/reinforce learning model development, validation, and serving.
• Interact cross-functionally with various teams and provide actionable business insights for stakeholders.
• Research new approaches in the field of machine learning, experimentation, causal inference, etc.

Qualifications and Skills
• Currently enrolled in a Master's or Ph.D. program in a quantitative discipline such as statistics, machine learning, computer science, math, economics, etc.
• Expertise in one or more of the following areas: machine learning & statistical learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, statistical analysis, experimentation, NLP, computer vision, recommendation system, and any other data science related domains;
• Experience in utilizing analytics, inference, experimentation, or machine learning techniques in real-world applications preferred;
• Good knowledge in data science methods and best practices, such as data analysis and visualization, supervised learning, unsupervised learning, and time series;
• Proficient in SQL and Python, R, or other related programming languages.

5 4 hours ago Full Job Description Responsibilities About TikTok TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video.
Our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.
TikTok has global offices including Los Angeles, New York, London, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Mumbai, Singapore, Jakarta, Seoul and Tokyo.
Why Join Us At TikTok, our people are humble, intelligent, compassionate and creative.
We create to inspire - for you, for us, and for more than 1 billion users on our platform.
We lead with curiosity and aim for the highest, never shying away from taking calculated risks and embracing ambiguity as it comes.
Here, the opportunities are limitless for those who dare to pursue bold ideas that exist just beyond the boundary of possibility.
Join us and make impact happen with a career at TikTok.
About USDS At TikTok, we're committed to a process of continuous innovation and improvement in our user experience and safety controls.
We're proud to be able to serve a global community of more than a billion people who use TikTok to creatively express themselves and be entertained, and we're dedicated to giving them a platform that builds opportunity and fosters connection.
We also take our responsibility to safeguard our community seriously, both in how we address potentially harmful content and how we protect against unauthorized access to user data.
U.
S.
Data Security (USDS) is a standalone department of TikTok in the U.
S.
This new security-first division was created to bring heightened focus and governance to our data protection policies and content assurance protocols to keep U.
S.
users safe.
Our focus is on providing oversight and protection of the TikTok platform and user data in the U.
S.
, so millions of Americans can continue turning to TikTok to learn something new, earn a living, express themselves creatively, or be entertained.
The teams within USDS that deliver on this commitment daily span Trust & Safety, Security & Privacy, Engineering, User & Product Ops, Corporate Functions and more.
About the team The USDS PM & Ops team focuses on TikTok Product development and platform user support.
Our product lines include User Growth, Live, Search, Feed Quality, Core Product, Creation Effect, and many more.
We are looking for a Data Analyst, US to build high-quality and timely data solutions and easy-to-use and scalable data products to support business growth.
You will have the exciting opportunity to:

Design and monitor core metrics; understand root causes of metric movements Design and build advanced analytical solutions and products to deliver superior business outcomes using research and performing quantitative and qualitative analysis Identify trends and opportunities to drive product growth and nurture a healthy ecosystem Understand underlying data sources and their limitations and communicate complex data insights through exploratory analysis and research to suggest improvement Qualifications

g.
Tableau, Looker) Self-motivated, detail-oriented, learn autonomously, and highly organized Ability to conduct rigorous analysis and communicate conclusions to both technical and non-technical audiences BA/BS in Computer Science, Math, Economics, Statistics, or other quantitative fields TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives.
Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace.
At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.
To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach.
We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
TikTok is committed to providing reasonable accommodations during our recruitment process.
If you need assistance or an accommodation, please reach out to us at usrc@tiktok.
com.

At ByteDance/TikTok our benefits are designed to convey company culture and values, to create an efficient and inspiring work environment, and to support ByteDancers to give their best in both work and life.

A 401K company match, gym and cellphone service reimbursements.

job_description:
Overview

At SSOE, our growth allows us to offer the opportunities normally associated with a large firm, while embracing the collaborative and supportive culture often found in smaller firms. You'll experience our employee-centric culture that strives to offer a healthy work-life balance, great employee benefits, and a mindset of continuous learning.

SSOE is looking to hire a skilled Project Data Analyst with expertise in reporting, dashboards, data analysis, Power BI, and the ability to code in VB or similar languages. As a Data Analyst, you will be responsible for analyzing complex data sets, creating and maintaining reports, financial data, and dashboards, and identifying trends and insights to help make informed business decisions. You will also develop and maintain data pipelines, automate data processes, and develop data visualizations using Power BI. This is a hybrid position located in either Hillsboro, OR or Phoenix, AZ.

Responsibilities
• Become familiar with core business, operations and services
• Interpret data, workflow, user, or stakeholders' inputs, documents, and analyze results
• Filter and normalize data by reviewing data, reports, dashboards, and performance indicators to locate and correct problems
• Analyze complex data sets and identify trends, patterns, and insights that can inform business decisions. Perform quality assurance as necessary
• Develop and maintain reports and dashboards using Power BI to monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) and track business performance
• Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and maintain databases/data systems
• Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify data needs and ensure data accuracy and consistency
• Automate data processes using scripting and coding languages
• Develop and maintain data visualizations using Power BI to provide insights to business stakeholders
• Perform ad-hoc analyses and data mining to support business needs
• Communicate key insights and findings to project team
• Understand capabilities and limitations of systems and database concepts
• Recommend and implement process improvements to deliver better value to stakeholders

Qualifications
• Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related field
• 2+ years of experience in data analysis, reporting, and dashboard development
• Demonstrated proficiency in the use of Power BI and Excel
• Strong VB or similar coding skills
• Experience with data visualization and dashboard development
• Strong analytical skills with the ability to analyze complex data sets
• Demonstrated experience in creating and maintaining reports, dashboards, and/or supporting processes
• Excellent communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams
• Salary Range: $80,000 - $100,000/year depending on location, education, experience, and any certifications that are directly related to the position.
• Benefits include health, dental and vision insurance, life insurance, 401K, PTO, & paid holidays.

Why Choose SSOE?

With a history of stability spanning more than 70 years, we've continued to succeed in an industry of constant change and disruption. Our clients have consistently reported to us that our people are one of our greatest strengths and differentiators. At SSOE, we work to create a clear path to building your career with us. Throughout your career, you'll be given the opportunity to work on new and exciting projects and be given training so you can deepen and extend your skills.

We look forward to having you join our team.

job_description:
At PNC, our people are our greatest differentiator and competitive advantage in the markets we serve. We are all united in delivering the best experience for our customers. We work together each day to foster an inclusive workplace culture where all of our employees feel respected, valued and have an opportunity to contribute to the company’s success. As an Intern within PNC's Data Analytics organization, you will be based in Pittsburgh, PA.

Job Description

As a PNC Intern, you will participate in a “best-in-class” internship program. During this 10-week program, you will have the opportunity to gain exposure to a specific line of business, expand the tools you need to launch your career and complement your education with real-world experience.

The Corporate & Institutional Banking (C&IB) and Asset Management Group (AMG) divisions are high-growth businesses within PNC committed to driving its growth through the use of advanced analytics and data science. The Data Analytics Internship Program provides interns with the opportunity to gain exposure to both divisions. Interns will support these businesses by providing analytical foresight and insight to help make effective business decisions related to client growth, product performance, operations and other business strategies.

Interns will gain exposure to a wide range of advanced analytical techniques to manipulate, analyze, interpret, and visualize various types, structures and volumes of data across C&IB and AMG. Interns will gain exposure to commercial portfolio analytics, data engineering, machine learning, and data visualization. It is expected that upon completion of the program, interns will have a stronger background in data analysis, computational modeling, programming languages and frameworks (SQL, Python, R, etc.), product development and deployment, exposure to the C&IB and AMG big data ecosystem and the ability to generate data-driven insights for the organization.

The Summer Internship Program is a direct pipeline for talent to the C&IB and AMG divisions, providing interns with an unparalleled opportunity to learn the business while gaining visibility among the firm’s senior leadership.

Opportunities in the Data Analytics Internship Program are primarily located in Pittsburgh.

Learn more about PNC’s Summer Internship by visiting www.pnc.jobs/students.

Job Profile:

Participates as an intern in the PNC summer internship program.
• Performs or assist the core activities of the group by applying knowledge learned to drive business results (e.g., deal, sales, process support, internal or external customer interaction, or supporting internal projects). Works under supervision and may have limited approval and/or exception authority.
• Participates in social learning within the organization (e.g., identifies and networks with business representatives and peers, participates in mentoring, job shadowing and community outreach projects).

Required Education and Experience:
• Working toward a Bachelor's Degree, preferably business relevant majors (e.g., Finance, Accounting, IT, Economics, Marketing, Mathematics, Statistics, HR, Management, Communications, Business Law, Psychology, Logistics, Engineering, Computer Science, Actuarial Sciences), sophomore or junior status, Minimum GPA 3.2.

PNC provides equal opportunity to qualified persons regardless of race, color, sex, religion, national origin, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, or other categories protected by law.

job_title: Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst
job_description:
Job Description

The Supply Chain & Materials Management (SCMM) Team is responsible for supply chain forecasting, scheduling, and inventory management to enable the Global Clinical Supply (GCS) business. The scope includes drug products, placebos, packaging components and clinical finished goods. The Team assures accurate siting and balancing of supply chain activities against work center capacity, and the efficient management of changes to minimize the risk of delivery to final depot. The group also maintains a keen forward-looking view of the overall clinical portfolio of demand and partners across the business to ensure execution strategy is well-positioned for future supply chain dynamics.

The Senior Specialist, Master Planning Data Analyst will support data analytics for the overall Master Planning Team for activities such as: siting, forecasting, scheduling, balancing, labeling, releasing, capacity management and any ad-hoc analysis and reporting related to the Master Planning scope of work. The Senior Specialist may be asked to generate, analyze, model, and visualize data to enable data-informed decision making, by understanding our organization's processes, and delivering relevant actionable insights.

The Senior Specialist will partner with the different areas of Master Planning to create, develop and implement a range of reports and solutions that will enable the incorporation of best practice data analytics into all aspects of day-to day business as well as ad-hoc evaluations. The Senior Specialist will partner with other stakeholders such as Logistics, Planning, Operations, Business Analytics, etc.) to develop and support new high business value digital applications and tools that meet both ongoing and developing business needs.

Primary responsibilities include but are not limited to:
• Support the Master Planning Team with data analytics and report creation.
• Provide ongoing support to the analytics tools being used across the Team.
• Support metric and KPI collection and tracking as needed.
• Collaborate with internal partners (both within and outside of GCS) to assess, align and optimize supply chain analytic tools.

Education:
• Bachelor's degree in data science, a related technical field, or equivalent professional experience.

Experience and Skills:
• 3+ years' experience using Data Analytics and Visualization tools. Knowledge of clinical supply processes preferred.
• Advance level of Excel - pivot tables, charts & graphs, calculations, data process automation, etc.
• Strong awareness of diversity and inclusion principles
• Proven track record of effective problem solving, and attention to detail.
• Strong organizational and time management skills and ability to prioritize tasks and initiatives appropriately.
• Results-orientation with the proven ability to execute on collaborative projects.
• Exceptional written and verbal communication and relationship skills along with high personal integrity, credibility, and energy.
• SAP supply chain knowledge and experience preferred.
• Demonstrated high level of initiative and ability to function independently with minimal or no daily supervision.

We are a research-driven biopharmaceutical company. Our mission is built on the simple premise that if we "follow the science" that great medicines can make a significant impact to our world. We believe that a research-driven enterprise dedicated to world-class science can succeed by inventing medicine and vaccine innovations that make a difference for patients across the globe.

Who we are ...

We are known as Merck & Co., Inc., Rahway, New Jersey, USA in the United States and Canada and MSD everywhere else. For more than a century, we have been inventing for life, bringing forward medicines and vaccines for many of the world's most challenging diseases. Today, our company continues to be at the forefront of research to deliver innovative health solutions and advance the prevention and treatment of diseases that threaten people and animals around the world.

What we look for ...

Imagine getting up in the morning for a job as important as helping to save and improve lives around the world. Here, you have that opportunity. You can put your empathy, creativity, digital mastery, or scientific genius to work in collaboration with a diverse group of colleagues who pursue and bring hope to countless people who are battling some of the most challenging diseases of our time. Our team is constantly evolving, so if you are among the intellectually curious, join us-and start making your impact today.

NOTICE FOR INTERNAL APPLICANTS

In accordance with Managers' Policy - Job Posting and Employee Placement, all employees subject to this policy are required to have a minimum of twelve (12) months of service in current position prior to applying for open positions.

If you have been offered a separation benefits package, but have not yet reached your separation date and are offered a position within the salary and geographical parameters as set forth in the Summary Plan Description (SPD) of your separation package, then you are no longer eligible for your separation benefits package. To discuss in more detail, please contact your HRBP or Talent Acquisition Advisor.
